content: 1 And it came to pass､ after the death of Moses the servant of Yahweh,—that Yahweh spake unto Joshua son of Nun, the attendant of Moses, saying:
content_old: 1 And it came to pass､ after the death of Moses the servant of Yahweh,—that Yahweh spake unto Joshua son of Nun, the attendant of Moses, saying:

content: 2 Moses my servant is dead,— Now therefore､ arise､ pass over this Jordan, thou､ and all this people､ into the land which I am giving unto them—unto the sons of Israel.
content_old: 2 Moses my servant is dead,— Now therefore､ arise､ pass over this Jordan, thou､ and all this people､ into the land which I am giving unto them—unto the sons of Israel.

content: 3 Every place whereon the sole of your foot shall tread unto you have I given it,—as I spake unto Moses.
content_old: 3 Every place whereon the sole of your foot shall tread unto you have I given it,—as I spake unto Moses.

content: 4 From the desert and this Lebanon､ even unto the great river—the river Euphrates､ all the land of the Hittites, and unto the great sea､ toward the going in of the sun shall be your boundary.
content_old: 4 From the desert and this Lebanon､ even unto the great river—the river Euphrates､ all the land of the Hittites, and unto the great sea､ toward the going in of the sun shall be your boundary.

content: 5 No man shall stand before thee, all the days of thy life,—as I was with Moses so I will be with thee, I will not fail thee､ neither will I forsake thee.
content_old: 5 No man shall stand before thee, all the days of thy life,—as I was with Moses so I will be with thee, I will not fail thee､ neither will I forsake thee.

content: 6 Be firm and bold,—for thou shalt cause this people to inherit the land which I sware unto their fathers,—to give unto them.
content_old: 6 Be firm and bold,—for thou shalt cause this people to inherit the land which I sware unto their fathers,—to give unto them.

content: 7 Only be very firm and bold､ taking heed to do according to all the law which Moses my servant commanded thee, do not turn aside therefrom､ to the right hand or to the left,—that thou mayest prosper, whithersoever thou goest.
content_old: 7 Only be very firm and bold､ taking heed to do according to all the law which Moses my servant commanded thee, do not turn aside therefrom､ to the right hand or to the left,—that thou mayest prosper, whithersoever thou goest.

content: 8 This scroll of the law must not cease out of thy mouth､ but thou must talk to thyself therein､ day and night, that thou mayest take heed to do according to all that is written therein,—for then shalt thou make thy way prosperous, and then shalt thou have good success.
content_old: 8 This scroll of the law must not cease out of thy mouth､ but thou must talk to thyself therein､ day and night, that thou mayest take heed to do according to all that is written therein,—for then shalt thou make thy way prosperous, and then shalt thou have good success.

content: 9 Have I not commanded thee､ Be firm and bold, do not start nor be dismayed,—for with thee is Yahweh thy God, whithersoever thou goest?
content_old: 9 Have I not commanded thee､ Be firm and bold, do not start nor be dismayed,—for with thee is Yahweh thy God, whithersoever thou goest?

content: 10 So then Joshua commanded the officers of the people､ saying:
content_old: 10 So then Joshua commanded the officers of the people､ saying:

content: 11 Pass ye through the midst of the camp､ and command the people､ saying: Make ready for yourselves､ provisions,—for in three days more are ye to pass over this Jordan, to go in and possess the land which Yahweh your God is giving you､ to possess.
content_old: 11 Pass ye through the midst of the camp､ and command the people､ saying: Make ready for yourselves､ provisions,—for in three days more are ye to pass over this Jordan, to go in and possess the land which Yahweh your God is giving you､ to possess.

content: 12 And unto the Reubenites､ and unto the Gadites､ and unto the half tribe of Manasseh spake Joshua､ saying:
content_old: 12 And unto the Reubenites､ and unto the Gadites､ and unto the half tribe of Manasseh spake Joshua､ saying:

content: 13 Remember the word which Moses the servant of Yahweh commanded you､ saying,— Yahweh your God is granting you rest, and doth give you this land.
content_old: 13 Remember the word which Moses the servant of Yahweh commanded you､ saying,— Yahweh your God is granting you rest, and doth give you this land.

content: 14 Your wives､ your little ones､ and your cattle shall remain in the land which Moses hath given you over the Jordan,—but ye shall pass over､ armed､ before your brethren,—all ye mighty men of valour, and shall help them;
content_old: 14 Your wives､ your little ones､ and your cattle shall remain in the land which Moses hath given you over the Jordan,—but ye shall pass over､ armed､ before your brethren,—all ye mighty men of valour, and shall help them;

content: 15 until that Yahweh shall grant rest unto your brethren､ as unto you, so shall they also possess the land which Yahweh your God giveth them,—then shall ye return unto the land of your possession､ and possess it, which Moses the servant of Yahweh hath given you over the Jordan､ towards the rising of the sun.
content_old: 15 until that Yahweh shall grant rest unto your brethren､ as unto you, so shall they also possess the land which Yahweh your God giveth them,—then shall ye return unto the land of your possession､ and possess it, which Moses the servant of Yahweh hath given you over the Jordan､ towards the rising of the sun.

content: 16 Then responded they to Joshua､ saying,— All that thou hast commanded us will we do, and whithersoever thou shalt send us will we go:
content_old: 16 Then responded they to Joshua､ saying,— All that thou hast commanded us will we do, and whithersoever thou shalt send us will we go:

content: 17 As in every thing we hearkened unto Moses so will we hearken unto thee,—only let Yahweh thy God be with thee, as he was with Moses.
content_old: 17 As in every thing we hearkened unto Moses so will we hearken unto thee,—only let Yahweh thy God be with thee, as he was with Moses.

content: 1 Then did Joshua son of Nun､ send cut from The Acacias､ two men to spy out silently､ saying, Go view the land､ and Jericho. So they came､ and entered the house of a harlot､ whose name was Rahab､ and lay there.
content_old: 1 Then did Joshua son of Nun､ send cut from The Acacias､ two men to spy out silently､ saying, Go view the land､ and Jericho. So they came､ and entered the house of a harlot､ whose name was Rahab､ and lay there.

content: 2 And it was told the king of Jericho､ saying,— Lo! men have come in hither to-night of the sons of Israel to search out the land.
content_old: 2 And it was told the king of Jericho､ saying,— Lo! men have come in hither to-night of the sons of Israel to search out the land.

content: 3 So the king of Jericho sent unto Rahab, saying,— Bring forth the men that are come in unto thee who have entered thy house, for to search out all the land have they come.
content_old: 3 So the king of Jericho sent unto Rahab, saying,— Bring forth the men that are come in unto thee who have entered thy house, for to search out all the land have they come.

content: 4 And the woman took the two men and hid them,—and said: Even so the men did come in unto me, but I knew not from whence they were;
content_old: 4 And the woman took the two men and hid them,—and said: Even so the men did come in unto me, but I knew not from whence they were;

content: 5 and it came to pass as the gate was about to be shut in the darkness that the men went out, I know not whither the men went,—pursue them quickly for ye shall overtake them.
content_old: 5 and it came to pass as the gate was about to be shut in the darkness that the men went out, I know not whither the men went,—pursue them quickly for ye shall overtake them.

content: 6 But she had taken them up to the roof,—and concealed them with the stalks of flax which she had laid in order for herself upon the roof.
content_old: 6 But she had taken them up to the roof,—and concealed them with the stalks of flax which she had laid in order for herself upon the roof.

content: 7 So the men pursued them by way of the Jordan unto the fords,—the gate being shut as soon as they who pursued them had gone forth.
content_old: 7 So the men pursued them by way of the Jordan unto the fords,—the gate being shut as soon as they who pursued them had gone forth.

content: 8 And ere yet they slep she went up unto them､ upon the roof;
content_old: 8 And ere yet they slep she went up unto them､ upon the roof;

content: 9 and said unto the men, I know that Yahweh hath given unto you the land,—and that the terror of you hath fallen upon us, and that all the inhabitants of the land have melted away from before you.
content_old: 9 and said unto the men, I know that Yahweh hath given unto you the land,—and that the terror of you hath fallen upon us, and that all the inhabitants of the land have melted away from before you.

content: 10 For we have heard how Yahweh dried up the waters of the Red Sea from before you, when ye came forth out of Egypt,—and what ye did unto the two kings of the Amorites who were over the Jordan unto Sihon and unto Og, whom ye devoted to destruction;
content_old: 10 For we have heard how Yahweh dried up the waters of the Red Sea from before you, when ye came forth out of Egypt,—and what ye did unto the two kings of the Amorites who were over the Jordan unto Sihon and unto Og, whom ye devoted to destruction;

content: 11 and when we heard then did our heart melt, and there rose up no longer any spirit in any man because of you,—for as for Yahweh your God he is God—in the heavens above, and upon the earth beneath.
content_old: 11 and when we heard then did our heart melt, and there rose up no longer any spirit in any man because of you,—for as for Yahweh your God he is God—in the heavens above, and upon the earth beneath.

content: 12 Now therefore I pray you､ swear unto me by Yahweh, since I have dealt with you in lovingkindness that ye also will deal with the house of my father in loving-kindness, and will give me a token of faithfulness.
content_old: 12 Now therefore I pray you､ swear unto me by Yahweh, since I have dealt with you in lovingkindness that ye also will deal with the house of my father in loving-kindness, and will give me a token of faithfulness.

content: 13 and will save alive my father and my mother､ and my brethren and my sisters, and all that they have,—and will deliver our souls from death.
content_old: 13 and will save alive my father and my mother､ and my brethren and my sisters, and all that they have,—and will deliver our souls from death.

content: 14 And the men said unto her Our souls in your stead unto death if ye utter not this our business,—so shall it be when Yahweh shall give us the land that we will deal with thee in lovingkindness and in faithfulness.
content_old: 14 And the men said unto her Our souls in your stead unto death if ye utter not this our business,—so shall it be when Yahweh shall give us the land that we will deal with thee in lovingkindness and in faithfulness.

content: 15 And she let them down with a cord through the window,—for her house was within the wall of the rampart, and within the rampart she was dwelling.
content_old: 15 And she let them down with a cord through the window,—for her house was within the wall of the rampart, and within the rampart she was dwelling.

content: 16 And she said unto them— To the mountain get you, lest the pursuers fall in with you,—and hide yourselves there､ three days until the pursuers return, and afterwards shall ye go your way.
content_old: 16 And she said unto them— To the mountain get you, lest the pursuers fall in with you,—and hide yourselves there､ three days until the pursuers return, and afterwards shall ye go your way.

content: 17 And the men said unto her,— Free will we be from this thine oath which thou hast made us swear:
content_old: 17 And the men said unto her,— Free will we be from this thine oath which thou hast made us swear:

content: 18 Lo! when we are coming into the land this cord of crimson thread must thou bind in the window by which thou didst let us down, and thy father and thy mother and thy brethren and all the household of thy father must thou gather together unto thee unto the house.
content_old: 18 Lo! when we are coming into the land this cord of crimson thread must thou bind in the window by which thou didst let us down, and thy father and thy mother and thy brethren and all the household of thy father must thou gather together unto thee unto the house.

content: 19 And it shall be whosoever shall go forth out of the doors of thy house into the street his blood shall be on his own head and we shall be free,—but whosoever shall be with thee in the house his blood shall be on our heads, if a hand be upon him.
content_old: 19 And it shall be whosoever shall go forth out of the doors of thy house into the street his blood shall be on his own head and we shall be free,—but whosoever shall be with thee in the house his blood shall be on our heads, if a hand be upon him.

content: 20 Or if thou utter this our business then shall we be free from this thine oath which thou hast made us swear.
content_old: 20 Or if thou utter this our business then shall we be free from this thine oath which thou hast made us swear.

content: 21 And she said— According to your words so shall it be. Thus sent she them away and they departed,—and she bound the crimson cord in the window.
content_old: 21 And she said— According to your words so shall it be. Thus sent she them away and they departed,—and she bound the crimson cord in the window.

content: 22 And they went and came into the mountain, and abode there three days, until the pursuers had returned,—so the pursuers made search throughout all the way, but found them not.
content_old: 22 And they went and came into the mountain, and abode there three days, until the pursuers had returned,—so the pursuers made search throughout all the way, but found them not.

content: 23 And the two men returned and came down out of the mountain, and crossed over and came unto Joshua､ son of Nun,���and recounted to him all that had befallen them;
content_old: 23 And the two men returned and came down out of the mountain, and crossed over and came unto Joshua､ son of Nun,���and recounted to him all that had befallen them;

content: 1 So then Joshua rose early in the morning､ and they brake up from The Acacias and came as far as the Jordan, he and all the sons of Israel,—and they lodged there before they passed over.
content_old: 1 So then Joshua rose early in the morning､ and they brake up from The Acacias and came as far as the Jordan, he and all the sons of Israel,—and they lodged there before they passed over.

content: 2 And it came to pass after three days that the officers went through the midst of the camp,
content_old: 2 And it came to pass after three days that the officers went through the midst of the camp,

content: 3 and commanded the people saying, When ye see the ark of the covenant of Yahweh your God, and the priests the Levites bearing it ye also shall break up out of your place, and come after it.
content_old: 3 and commanded the people saying, When ye see the ark of the covenant of Yahweh your God, and the priests the Levites bearing it ye also shall break up out of your place, and come after it.

content: 4 Yet shall there be a distance between you and it, about two thousand cubits by measure,—do not come near unto it that ye may get to know the way by which ye must go, for ye have not passed this way､ heretofore.
content_old: 4 Yet shall there be a distance between you and it, about two thousand cubits by measure,—do not come near unto it that ye may get to know the way by which ye must go, for ye have not passed this way､ heretofore.

content: 5 Then said Joshua unto the people､ Hallow yourselves,—for to-morrow will Yahwell do in your midst､ wonderful things.
content_old: 5 Then said Joshua unto the people､ Hallow yourselves,—for to-morrow will Yahwell do in your midst､ wonderful things.

content: 6 And Joshua spake unto the priests､ saying, Take ye up the ark of the covenant, and pass on before the people. So they took up the ark of the covenant, and went on before the people.
content_old: 6 And Joshua spake unto the priests､ saying, Take ye up the ark of the covenant, and pass on before the people. So they took up the ark of the covenant, and went on before the people.

content: 7 Then said Yahweh unto Joshua: This day will I begin to magnify thee in the eyes of all Israel,—who shall know, that as I was with Moses I will be with thee.
content_old: 7 Then said Yahweh unto Joshua: This day will I begin to magnify thee in the eyes of all Israel,—who shall know, that as I was with Moses I will be with thee.

content: 8 Thou therefore､ shalt command the priests who are bearing the ark of the covenant､ saying,— When ye are come as far as the edge of the waters of the Jordan in the Jordan shall ye stand.
content_old: 8 Thou therefore､ shalt command the priests who are bearing the ark of the covenant､ saying,— When ye are come as far as the edge of the waters of the Jordan in the Jordan shall ye stand.

content: 9 Then said Joshua､ unto the sons of Israel,— Draw near hither, and hear ye the words of Yahweh your God.
content_old: 9 Then said Joshua､ unto the sons of Israel,— Draw near hither, and hear ye the words of Yahweh your God.

content: 10 And Joshua said, Hereby shall ye know, that a Living GOD is in your midst,—and that he will certainly dispossess from before you､ the Canaanite and the Hittite､ and the Hivite and the Perizzite､ and the Girgashite, and the Amorite､ and the Jebusite.
content_old: 10 And Joshua said, Hereby shall ye know, that a Living GOD is in your midst,—and that he will certainly dispossess from before you､ the Canaanite and the Hittite､ and the Hivite and the Perizzite､ and the Girgashite, and the Amorite､ and the Jebusite.

content: 11 Lo! the ark of the covenant of the Lord of all the earth is about to pass before you into the Jordan.
content_old: 11 Lo! the ark of the covenant of the Lord of all the earth is about to pass before you into the Jordan.

content: 12 Now therefore､ take you twelve men, out of the tribes of Israel,—one man severally for each tribe;
content_old: 12 Now therefore､ take you twelve men, out of the tribes of Israel,—one man severally for each tribe;

content: 13 and it shall be､ when the soles of the feet of the priests who are bearing the ark of Yahweh､ Lord of all the earth､ do rest in the waters of the Jordan the waters of the Jordan shall be cut off, the waters that are coming down from above,—and shall stand in one mound.
content_old: 13 and it shall be､ when the soles of the feet of the priests who are bearing the ark of Yahweh､ Lord of all the earth､ do rest in the waters of the Jordan the waters of the Jordan shall be cut off, the waters that are coming down from above,—and shall stand in one mound.

content: 14 And it came to pass､ when the people set out from their tents, to cross the Jordan,—with the priests､ bearing the ark of the covenant before the people,
content_old: 14 And it came to pass､ when the people set out from their tents, to cross the Jordan,—with the priests､ bearing the ark of the covenant before the people,

content: 15 then as the bearers of the ark came as far as the Jordan, and the feet of the priests who were bearing the ark were dipped in the edge of the waters,—the Jordan being full over all his banks, all the days of harvest
content_old: 15 then as the bearers of the ark came as far as the Jordan, and the feet of the priests who were bearing the ark were dipped in the edge of the waters,—the Jordan being full over all his banks, all the days of harvest

content: 16 that the waters which were coming down from above､ stood—rose up in one mound､ a great way off､ by the city Adam､ which is beside Zarethan, and they which were going down to the sea of the waste plain､ the salt sea failed—were cut off,—and the people passed over､ right against Jericho.
content_old: 16 that the waters which were coming down from above､ stood—rose up in one mound､ a great way off､ by the city Adam､ which is beside Zarethan, and they which were going down to the sea of the waste plain､ the salt sea failed—were cut off,—and the people passed over､ right against Jericho.

content: 1 And it came to pass､ when all the nation had made an end of passing over the Jordan that Yahweh spake unto Joshua､ saying:
content_old: 1 And it came to pass､ when all the nation had made an end of passing over the Jordan that Yahweh spake unto Joshua､ saying:

content: 2 Take unto you､ from among the people､ twelve men, one man severally from each tribe;
content_old: 2 Take unto you､ from among the people､ twelve men, one man severally from each tribe;

content: 3 and command ye them､ saying, Take you up from hence､ out of the midst of the Jordan､ from the place where stood the feet of the priests with firm footing､ twelve stones,—and carry them over with you, and lay them down in the lodging-place where ye shall lodge､ to-night.
content_old: 3 and command ye them､ saying, Take you up from hence､ out of the midst of the Jordan､ from the place where stood the feet of the priests with firm footing､ twelve stones,—and carry them over with you, and lay them down in the lodging-place where ye shall lodge､ to-night.

content: 4 So Joshua called unto the twelve men whom he had made ready､ from among the sons of Israel,—one man severally out of each tribe;
content_old: 4 So Joshua called unto the twelve men whom he had made ready､ from among the sons of Israel,—one man severally out of each tribe;

content: 5 and Joshua said unto them: Pass ye over､ before the ark of Yahweh your God､ into the midst of the Jordan,—and life ye up､ each man one stone upon his shoulder, according to the number of the tribes of the sons of Israel:
content_old: 5 and Joshua said unto them: Pass ye over､ before the ark of Yahweh your God､ into the midst of the Jordan,—and life ye up､ each man one stone upon his shoulder, according to the number of the tribes of the sons of Israel:

content: 6 that this may be a sign in your midst,—for your sons will ask in time to come､ saying, What mean these stones to you?
content_old: 6 that this may be a sign in your midst,—for your sons will ask in time to come､ saying, What mean these stones to you?

content: 7 Then shall ye say unto them— That the waters of the Jordan were cut off from before the ark of the covenant of Yahweh, when it passed into the Jordan the waters of the Jordan were out off. So shall these stones become a memorial unto the sons of Israel､ unto times age-abiding.
content_old: 7 Then shall ye say unto them— That the waters of the Jordan were cut off from before the ark of the covenant of Yahweh, when it passed into the Jordan the waters of the Jordan were out off. So shall these stones become a memorial unto the sons of Israel､ unto times age-abiding.

content: 8 And the sons of Israel did so､ as Joshua commanded, and took up twelve stones out of the midst of the Jordan､ as spake Yahweh unto Joshua, according to the number of the tribes of the sons of Israel,—and carried them with them unto the place where they lodged, and laid them down there.
content_old: 8 And the sons of Israel did so､ as Joshua commanded, and took up twelve stones out of the midst of the Jordan､ as spake Yahweh unto Joshua, according to the number of the tribes of the sons of Israel,—and carried them with them unto the place where they lodged, and laid them down there.

content: 9 Twelve stones also did Joshua set up in the midst of the Jordan, in the place where stood the feet of the priests who were bearing the ark of the covenant,—and they have remained there until this day.
content_old: 9 Twelve stones also did Joshua set up in the midst of the Jordan, in the place where stood the feet of the priests who were bearing the ark of the covenant,—and they have remained there until this day.

content: 10 Now the priests who were bearing the ark continued standing in the midst of the Jordan, until everything was finished which Yahweh commanded Joshua､ to speak unto the people, according to all that Moses commanded Joshua,—the people therefore hasted､ and passed over.
content_old: 10 Now the priests who were bearing the ark continued standing in the midst of the Jordan, until everything was finished which Yahweh commanded Joshua､ to speak unto the people, according to all that Moses commanded Joshua,—the people therefore hasted､ and passed over.

content: 11 And so it was､ as soon as all the people had made an end of passing over,—then passed over the ark of Yahweh､ and the priests､ in presence of the people.
content_old: 11 And so it was､ as soon as all the people had made an end of passing over,—then passed over the ark of Yahweh､ and the priests､ in presence of the people.

content: 12 Also the sons of Reuben and the sons of Gad and the half tribe of Manasseh､ passed over armed, before the sons of Israel,—as Moses had spoken unto them:
content_old: 12 Also the sons of Reuben and the sons of Gad and the half tribe of Manasseh､ passed over armed, before the sons of Israel,—as Moses had spoken unto them:

content: 13 about forty thousand､ equipped for the war passed over before Yahweh､ to battle, into the waste plains of Jericho.
content_old: 13 about forty thousand､ equipped for the war passed over before Yahweh､ to battle, into the waste plains of Jericho.

content: 14 On that day did Yahweh magnify Joshua in the eyes of all Israel,—and they revered him, as they revered Moses､ all the days of his life.
content_old: 14 On that day did Yahweh magnify Joshua in the eyes of all Israel,—and they revered him, as they revered Moses､ all the days of his life.

content: 15 Then spake Yahweh unto Joshua､ saying:
content_old: 15 Then spake Yahweh unto Joshua､ saying:

content: 16 Command the priests who are bearing the ark of testimony,—that they come up out of the Jordan.
content_old: 16 Command the priests who are bearing the ark of testimony,—that they come up out of the Jordan.

content: 17 So Joshua commanded the priests､ saying,— Come ye up out of the Jordan.
content_old: 17 So Joshua commanded the priests､ saying,— Come ye up out of the Jordan.

content: 18 And it came to pass when the priests who were bearing the ark of the covenant of Yahweh came up out of the midst of the Jordan, and the soles of the feet of the priests were withdrawn unto the dry ground then returned the waters of the Jordan unto their place, and went､ as before､ over all his banks.
content_old: 18 And it came to pass when the priests who were bearing the ark of the covenant of Yahweh came up out of the midst of the Jordan, and the soles of the feet of the priests were withdrawn unto the dry ground then returned the waters of the Jordan unto their place, and went､ as before､ over all his banks.

content: 19 So the people came up out of the Jordan, on the tenth of the first month,—and encamped in Gilgal, at the eastern end of Jericho.
content_old: 19 So the people came up out of the Jordan, on the tenth of the first month,—and encamped in Gilgal, at the eastern end of Jericho.

content: 20 And these twelve stones which they took out of the Jordan did Joshua set up､ in Gilgal.
content_old: 20 And these twelve stones which they took out of the Jordan did Joshua set up､ in Gilgal.

content: 21 Then spake he unto the sons of Israel､ saying,— When your sons shall ask､ in time to come､ of their fathers､ saying,— What mean these stones?
content_old: 21 Then spake he unto the sons of Israel､ saying,— When your sons shall ask､ in time to come､ of their fathers､ saying,— What mean these stones?

content: 22 then shall ye let your sons know､ saying,— On dry ground came Israel over this Jordan;
content_old: 22 then shall ye let your sons know､ saying,— On dry ground came Israel over this Jordan;

content: 23 in that Yahweh your God dried up the waters of the Jordan､ from before you､ until ye had passed over,—as Yahweh your God had done unto the Red Sea､ which he dried up from before us､ until we had passed over:
content_old: 23 in that Yahweh your God dried up the waters of the Jordan､ from before you､ until ye had passed over,—as Yahweh your God had done unto the Red Sea､ which he dried up from before us､ until we had passed over:

content: 1 And it came to pass when all the kings of the Amorites who were over the Jordan westward､ and all the kings of the Canaanites who were by the sea, heard how that Yahweh had dried up the waters of the Jordan､ from before the sons of Israel､ until they had passed over that their heart melted､ and there was no spirit in them any more, because of the sons of Israel.
content_old: 1 And it came to pass when all the kings of the Amorites who were over the Jordan westward､ and all the kings of the Canaanites who were by the sea, heard how that Yahweh had dried up the waters of the Jordan､ from before the sons of Israel､ until they had passed over that their heart melted､ and there was no spirit in them any more, because of the sons of Israel.

content: 2 At that time said Yahweh unto Joshua, Make thee knives of flint,—and again circumcise the sons of Israel a second time.
content_old: 2 At that time said Yahweh unto Joshua, Make thee knives of flint,—and again circumcise the sons of Israel a second time.

content: 3 So Joshua made him knives of flint,—and circumcised the sons of Israel, at the Hill of Foreskins.
content_old: 3 So Joshua made him knives of flint,—and circumcised the sons of Israel, at the Hill of Foreskins.

content: 4 Now this is the cause why Joshua did circumcise,—all the people who came forth out of Egypt､ who were males､ all the men of war died in the desert､ by the way, after they came forth out of Egypt.
content_old: 4 Now this is the cause why Joshua did circumcise,—all the people who came forth out of Egypt､ who were males､ all the men of war died in the desert､ by the way, after they came forth out of Egypt.

content: 5 For though all the people who came forth had been circumcised yet all the people who were born in the desert by the way､ after they came forth out of Egypt had they not circumcised.
content_old: 5 For though all the people who came forth had been circumcised yet all the people who were born in the desert by the way､ after they came forth out of Egypt had they not circumcised.

content: 6 Because for forty years did the sons of Israel journey in the desert, until all the nation who were men of war､ who came forth out of Egypt､ were consumed, because they hearkened not unto the voice of Yahweh,—unto whom Yahweh sware that he would not let them see the land､ which Yahweh sware unto their fathers､ that he would give unto us, a land flowing with milk and honey.
content_old: 6 Because for forty years did the sons of Israel journey in the desert, until all the nation who were men of war､ who came forth out of Egypt､ were consumed, because they hearkened not unto the voice of Yahweh,—unto whom Yahweh sware that he would not let them see the land､ which Yahweh sware unto their fathers､ that he would give unto us, a land flowing with milk and honey.

content: 7 Their sons､ therefore､ whom he had raised up in their stead them did Joshua circumcise,—for uncircumcised they were, in that they had not circumcised them by the way.
content_old: 7 Their sons､ therefore､ whom he had raised up in their stead them did Joshua circumcise,—for uncircumcised they were, in that they had not circumcised them by the way.

content: 8 And so it came to pass､ when they had made an end of circumcising all the nation they remained in their place､ in the camp､ until they were healed.
content_old: 8 And so it came to pass､ when they had made an end of circumcising all the nation they remained in their place､ in the camp､ until they were healed.

content: 9 Then said Yahweh unto Joshua, To-day have I rolled away the reproach of Egypt from off you. Wherefore the name of that place is called Gilgal i.e. a rolling away unto this day.
content_old: 9 Then said Yahweh unto Joshua, To-day have I rolled away the reproach of Egypt from off you. Wherefore the name of that place is called Gilgal i.e. a rolling away unto this day.

content: 10 Thus then the sons of Israel encamped in Gilgal,���and kept the passover on the fourteenth day of the month､ in the evening､ in the waste plains of Jericho.
content_old: 10 Thus then the sons of Israel encamped in Gilgal,���and kept the passover on the fourteenth day of the month､ in the evening､ in the waste plains of Jericho.

content: 11 And they did eat of the corn of the land､ on the morrow of the passover､ unleavened cakes and parched ears of corn,—on this selfsame day.
content_old: 11 And they did eat of the corn of the land､ on the morrow of the passover､ unleavened cakes and parched ears of corn,—on this selfsame day.

content: 12 And the manna ceased on the morrow､ when they had eaten of the corn of the land, neither had the sons of Israel manna any more,—so they did eat of the yield of the land of Canaan throughout that year.
content_old: 12 And the manna ceased on the morrow､ when they had eaten of the corn of the land, neither had the sons of Israel manna any more,—so they did eat of the yield of the land of Canaan throughout that year.

content: 13 And it came to pass while Joshua was at Jericho that he lifted up his eyes､ and looked, and lo! a man､ standing over against him, with his sword drawn､ in his hand,—so Joshua went unto him､ and said to him, For us art thou, or for our adversaries?
content_old: 13 And it came to pass while Joshua was at Jericho that he lifted up his eyes､ and looked, and lo! a man､ standing over against him, with his sword drawn､ in his hand,—so Joshua went unto him､ and said to him, For us art thou, or for our adversaries?

content: 14 And he said— Nay､ but I as prince of the host of Yahweh have now come. So Joshua fell on his face to the earth､ and worshipped, and said unto him, What is my lord speaking unto his servant?
content_old: 14 And he said— Nay､ but I as prince of the host of Yahweh have now come. So Joshua fell on his face to the earth､ and worshipped, and said unto him, What is my lord speaking unto his servant?

content: 1 Now Jericho was shut up and barred because of the sons of Israel,—none came out and none went in.
content_old: 1 Now Jericho was shut up and barred because of the sons of Israel,—none came out and none went in.

content: 2 Then said Yahweh unto Joshua, See I have delivered, into thy hand, Jericho and her king,—the mighty men of valour.
content_old: 2 Then said Yahweh unto Joshua, See I have delivered, into thy hand, Jericho and her king,—the mighty men of valour.

content: 3 So then ye shall compass the city all ye men of war, going round the city､ once,—thus shalt thou do six days.
content_old: 3 So then ye shall compass the city all ye men of war, going round the city､ once,—thus shalt thou do six days.

content: 4 And seven priests shall bear the seven rams’ horns before the ark, and on the seventh day shall ye compass the city seven times,—and the priests shall blow with the horns.
content_old: 4 And seven priests shall bear the seven rams’ horns before the ark, and on the seventh day shall ye compass the city seven times,—and the priests shall blow with the horns.

content: 5 And it shall come to pass when the rams horn soundeth､ when ye hear the sound of the horn that all the people shall shout with a great shout,—and then shall the wall of the city fall down under it, and the people shall go up every man straight before him.
content_old: 5 And it shall come to pass when the rams horn soundeth､ when ye hear the sound of the horn that all the people shall shout with a great shout,—and then shall the wall of the city fall down under it, and the people shall go up every man straight before him.

content: 6 Then called Joshua son of Nun unto the priests, and said unto them, Bear ye the ark of the covenant,—and let seven priests bear seven rams’ horns, before the ark of Yahweh.
content_old: 6 Then called Joshua son of Nun unto the priests, and said unto them, Bear ye the ark of the covenant,—and let seven priests bear seven rams’ horns, before the ark of Yahweh.

content: 7 Then said he unto the people, Pass on and compass the city,—and let the armed host pass on before the ark of Yahweh.
content_old: 7 Then said he unto the people, Pass on and compass the city,—and let the armed host pass on before the ark of Yahweh.

content: 8 And it was so, when Joshua had spoken unto the people that the seven priests who were bearing the seven rams’ horns before Yahweh passed on and blew with the horns,—the ark of the covenant of Yahweh also coming after them.
content_old: 8 And it was so, when Joshua had spoken unto the people that the seven priests who were bearing the seven rams’ horns before Yahweh passed on and blew with the horns,—the ark of the covenant of Yahweh also coming after them.

content: 9 And the armed host went on before the priests who blew with the horns,—and the rear-guard came after the ark, going on and blowing with the horns.
content_old: 9 And the armed host went on before the priests who blew with the horns,—and the rear-guard came after the ark, going on and blowing with the horns.

content: 10 Now unto the people had Joshua given command saying— Ye shall not shout nor let your voice be heard, neither shall there go out of your mouth a word,—until the day when I say unto you Shout! then shall ye shout.
content_old: 10 Now unto the people had Joshua given command saying— Ye shall not shout nor let your voice be heard, neither shall there go out of your mouth a word,—until the day when I say unto you Shout! then shall ye shout.

content: 11 So he caused the ark of Yahweh to compass the city, going round once,—and they came into the camp, and lodged in the camp.
content_old: 11 So he caused the ark of Yahweh to compass the city, going round once,—and they came into the camp, and lodged in the camp.

content: 12 And Joshua rose early in the morning,—and the priests bare the ark of Yahweh;
content_old: 12 And Joshua rose early in the morning,—and the priests bare the ark of Yahweh;

content: 13 and the seven priests who bare the seven rams’ horns before the ark of Yahweh went on and on, and blew with the horns,—with the armed host going on before them, and the rear-guard coming after the ark of Yahweh, going on and blowing with the horns.
content_old: 13 and the seven priests who bare the seven rams’ horns before the ark of Yahweh went on and on, and blew with the horns,—with the armed host going on before them, and the rear-guard coming after the ark of Yahweh, going on and blowing with the horns.

content: 14 So they compassed the city on the second day once, and returned into the camp,—thus did they､ six days.
content_old: 14 So they compassed the city on the second day once, and returned into the camp,—thus did they､ six days.

content: 15 And it came to pass on the seventh day that they rose early at the uprisings of the dawn, and compassed the city after this manner､ seven times,—only on that day they compassed the city seven times.
content_old: 15 And it came to pass on the seventh day that they rose early at the uprisings of the dawn, and compassed the city after this manner､ seven times,—only on that day they compassed the city seven times.

content: 16 And it came to pass at the seventh time—when the priests blew with the horns then did Joshua say unto the people— Shout, for Yahweh hath delivered unto you the city.
content_old: 16 And it came to pass at the seventh time—when the priests blew with the horns then did Joshua say unto the people— Shout, for Yahweh hath delivered unto you the city.

content: 17 And it shall be､ that as for the city devoted shall it be and all that is therein unto Yahweh,—nevertheless, Rahab the harlot shall live she and all who are with her in the house because she hid the messengers whom we sent.
content_old: 17 And it shall be､ that as for the city devoted shall it be and all that is therein unto Yahweh,—nevertheless, Rahab the harlot shall live she and all who are with her in the house because she hid the messengers whom we sent.

content: 18 But in any wise do ye beware of what is devoted, lest ye should covet､ and then take of what is devoted,—and so cause the camp of Israel to be devoted, and bring trouble upon it.
content_old: 18 But in any wise do ye beware of what is devoted, lest ye should covet､ and then take of what is devoted,—and so cause the camp of Israel to be devoted, and bring trouble upon it.

content: 19 But as for all silver and gold and vessels of bronze and iron hallowed it is to Yahweh,—unto the treasury of Yahweh shall it come.
content_old: 19 But as for all silver and gold and vessels of bronze and iron hallowed it is to Yahweh,—unto the treasury of Yahweh shall it come.

content: 20 So the people shouted, when the horns were blown,—yea it came to pass when the people heard the sound of the horn that the people shouted with a great shout, and the wall fell down under it､ and the people went up into the city every man straight before him, and so they captured the city.
content_old: 20 So the people shouted, when the horns were blown,—yea it came to pass when the people heard the sound of the horn that the people shouted with a great shout, and the wall fell down under it､ and the people went up into the city every man straight before him, and so they captured the city.

content: 21 And they devoted all that were in the city, both man and woman､ both young and old,—and ox and sheep and ass with the edge of the sword.
content_old: 21 And they devoted all that were in the city, both man and woman､ both young and old,—and ox and sheep and ass with the edge of the sword.

content: 22 But unto the two men who spied out the land Joshua said, Go into the house of the woman the harlot,—and bring out thence the woman and all that she hath, as ye sware unto her.
content_old: 22 But unto the two men who spied out the land Joshua said, Go into the house of the woman the harlot,—and bring out thence the woman and all that she hath, as ye sware unto her.

content: 23 So the young men the spies went in and brought out Rahab and her father and her mother and her brethren and all that she had, yea all her kindred brought they out,—and set them outside the camp of Israel.
content_old: 23 So the young men the spies went in and brought out Rahab and her father and her mother and her brethren and all that she had, yea all her kindred brought they out,—and set them outside the camp of Israel.

content: 24 But the city burned they with fire､ and all that was therein,—save only the silver and the gold and the vessels of bronze and of iron put they into the treasury of the house of Yahweh.
content_old: 24 But the city burned they with fire､ and all that was therein,—save only the silver and the gold and the vessels of bronze and of iron put they into the treasury of the house of Yahweh.

content: 25 And Rahab the harlot and the household of her father and all that she had did Joshua save alive, so she hath dwelt in the midst of Israel until this day,—because she hid the messengers whom Joshua sent to spy out Jericho.
content_old: 25 And Rahab the harlot and the household of her father and all that she had did Joshua save alive, so she hath dwelt in the midst of Israel until this day,—because she hid the messengers whom Joshua sent to spy out Jericho.

content: 26 And Joshua imposed an oath at that time､ saying,— Cursed be the man before Yahweh who shall raise up and build this city—Jericho, At the price of his firstborn shall he lay its foundation, And at the price of his youngest shall he set up its doors.
content_old: 26 And Joshua imposed an oath at that time､ saying,— Cursed be the man before Yahweh who shall raise up and build this city—Jericho, At the price of his firstborn shall he lay its foundation, And at the price of his youngest shall he set up its doors.

content: 1 But the sons of Israel had committed an act of unfaithfulness in respect of what was devoted､—for Achan son of Carmi son of Zabdi, son of Zerah, of the tribe of Judah had taken of what was devoted, and the anger of Yahweh had kindled against the sons of Israel.
content_old: 1 But the sons of Israel had committed an act of unfaithfulness in respect of what was devoted､—for Achan son of Carmi son of Zabdi, son of Zerah, of the tribe of Judah had taken of what was devoted, and the anger of Yahweh had kindled against the sons of Israel.

content: 2 And Joshua sent men from Jericho to Ai which was beside Beth-aven on the east side of Bethel, and spake unto them saying, Go up and spy out the land. So the men went up, and spied out Ai.
content_old: 2 And Joshua sent men from Jericho to Ai which was beside Beth-aven on the east side of Bethel, and spake unto them saying, Go up and spy out the land. So the men went up, and spied out Ai.

content: 3 And they returned unto Joshua and said unto him— Let not all the people go up, about two thousand men or three thousand men can go up and smite Ai,—do not weary the whole people to go thither, for but few they are.
content_old: 3 And they returned unto Joshua and said unto him— Let not all the people go up, about two thousand men or three thousand men can go up and smite Ai,—do not weary the whole people to go thither, for but few they are.

content: 4 There went up thither of the people therefore､ about three thousand men,—but they fled before the men of Ai.
content_old: 4 There went up thither of the people therefore､ about three thousand men,—but they fled before the men of Ai.

content: 5 And the men of Ai smote of them about thirty-six men, and pursued them before the gate as far as the Shebarim. and smote them on the slope,—so that the heart of the people melted and became as water.
content_old: 5 And the men of Ai smote of them about thirty-six men, and pursued them before the gate as far as the Shebarim. and smote them on the slope,—so that the heart of the people melted and became as water.

content: 6 Then Joshua rent his clothes and fell upon his face to the earth before the ark of Yahweh until the evening, he and the elders of Israel,—and they lifted up dust upon their heads.
content_old: 6 Then Joshua rent his clothes and fell upon his face to the earth before the ark of Yahweh until the evening, he and the elders of Israel,—and they lifted up dust upon their heads.

content: 7 And Joshua said— Alas! My Lord Yahweh! Wherefore hast thou brought this people over the Jordan, to deliver us into the hand of the Amorite to destroy us? Would then we had been content to dwell on the other side of the Jordan!
content_old: 7 And Joshua said— Alas! My Lord Yahweh! Wherefore hast thou brought this people over the Jordan, to deliver us into the hand of the Amorite to destroy us? Would then we had been content to dwell on the other side of the Jordan!

content: 8 Oh My Lord,—what shall I say, after Israel have turned their backs before their enemies?
content_old: 8 Oh My Lord,—what shall I say, after Israel have turned their backs before their enemies?

content: 9 Only let the Canaanite and all the inhabitants of the land hear and they will surround us, and cut off our name out of the earth,—what then wilt thou do for thy great name?
content_old: 9 Only let the Canaanite and all the inhabitants of the land hear and they will surround us, and cut off our name out of the earth,—what then wilt thou do for thy great name?

content: 10 And Yahweh said unto Joshua— Get thee up! wherefore is it that thou art lying upon thy face?
content_old: 10 And Yahweh said unto Joshua— Get thee up! wherefore is it that thou art lying upon thy face?

content: 11 Israel hath sinned, yea moreover they have transgressed my covenant which I commanded them,—yea moreover they have taken of what was devoted, yea moreover they have stolen yea moreover they have dissembled, yea moreover they have put it among their own goods.
content_old: 11 Israel hath sinned, yea moreover they have transgressed my covenant which I commanded them,—yea moreover they have taken of what was devoted, yea moreover they have stolen yea moreover they have dissembled, yea moreover they have put it among their own goods.

content: 12 Therefore cannot the sons of Israel stand before their enemies, their back do they turn before their enemies, because they have become devoted,—I will no more be with you, except ye destroy the devoted thing out of your midst.
content_old: 12 Therefore cannot the sons of Israel stand before their enemies, their back do they turn before their enemies, because they have become devoted,—I will no more be with you, except ye destroy the devoted thing out of your midst.

content: 13 Up! hallow the people, and thou shalt say Hallow yourselves by to-morrow,—for Thus saith Yahweh God of Israel: A devoted thing is in the midst of thee O Israel, Thou canst not stand before thine enemies, until ye have put away the devoted thing out of your midst.
content_old: 13 Up! hallow the people, and thou shalt say Hallow yourselves by to-morrow,—for Thus saith Yahweh God of Israel: A devoted thing is in the midst of thee O Israel, Thou canst not stand before thine enemies, until ye have put away the devoted thing out of your midst.

content: 14 Therefore shall ye be brought near in the morning by your tribes,—and it shall be that— The tribe which Yahweh shall seize shall come near by families and The family which Yahweh shall seize shall come near by households and The household which Yahweh shall seize shall come near man by man;
content_old: 14 Therefore shall ye be brought near in the morning by your tribes,—and it shall be that— The tribe which Yahweh shall seize shall come near by families and The family which Yahweh shall seize shall come near by households and The household which Yahweh shall seize shall come near man by man;

content: 15 and it shall be, that— He that is seized with the devoted thing shall be burned with fire, he and all that he hath,— because he hath transgressed the covenant of Yahweh, and because he hath wrought impiety in Israel.
content_old: 15 and it shall be, that— He that is seized with the devoted thing shall be burned with fire, he and all that he hath,— because he hath transgressed the covenant of Yahweh, and because he hath wrought impiety in Israel.

content: 16 So Joshua rose up early in the morning, and brought Israel near by their tribes,—and the tribe of Judah was seized;
content_old: 16 So Joshua rose up early in the morning, and brought Israel near by their tribes,—and the tribe of Judah was seized;

content: 17 and he brought near the family of Judah, and the family of the Zarhites was seized,—and he brought near the family of the Zarhites man by man, and Zabdi was seized;
content_old: 17 and he brought near the family of Judah, and the family of the Zarhites was seized,—and he brought near the family of the Zarhites man by man, and Zabdi was seized;

content: 18 and he brought near his household man by man,—and Achan son of Carmi son of Zabdi son of Zerah､ of the tribe of Judah was seized.
content_old: 18 and he brought near his household man by man,—and Achan son of Carmi son of Zabdi son of Zerah､ of the tribe of Judah was seized.

content: 19 And Joshua said unto Achan— My son give I pray thee glory unto Yahweh God of Israel and make to him confession,—and tell me I pray thee what thou hast done, do not hide it from me.
content_old: 19 And Joshua said unto Achan— My son give I pray thee glory unto Yahweh God of Israel and make to him confession,—and tell me I pray thee what thou hast done, do not hide it from me.

content: 20 And Achan answered Joshua and said,— Of a truth I have sinned against Yahweh God of Israel, and thus and thus have I done:
content_old: 20 And Achan answered Joshua and said,— Of a truth I have sinned against Yahweh God of Israel, and thus and thus have I done:

content: 21 When I saw among the spoil a certain goodly mantle of Babylonia and two hundred shekels of silver and a certain wedge of gold—fifty shekels the weight thereof then I coveted them､ then I took them,—and there they are hid in the earth､ in the midst of my tent､ and the silver under it.
content_old: 21 When I saw among the spoil a certain goodly mantle of Babylonia and two hundred shekels of silver and a certain wedge of gold—fifty shekels the weight thereof then I coveted them､ then I took them,—and there they are hid in the earth､ in the midst of my tent､ and the silver under it.

content: 22 So Joshua sent messengers, and they ran unto the tent,—and there it was hid in his tent､ and the silver under it.
content_old: 22 So Joshua sent messengers, and they ran unto the tent,—and there it was hid in his tent､ and the silver under it.

content: 23 And they took them out of the midst of the tent, and brought them in unto Joshua, and unto all the sons of Israel,—and poured them out before Yahweh.
content_old: 23 And they took them out of the midst of the tent, and brought them in unto Joshua, and unto all the sons of Israel,—and poured them out before Yahweh.

content: 24 And Joshua､ and all Israel with him､ took Achan—son of Zerah､ and the silver and the mantle and the wedge of gold､ and his sons and his daughters､ and his oxen and his asses and his sheep and his tent､ and all that he had, and brought them up the valley of Achor.
content_old: 24 And Joshua､ and all Israel with him､ took Achan—son of Zerah､ and the silver and the mantle and the wedge of gold､ and his sons and his daughters､ and his oxen and his asses and his sheep and his tent､ and all that he had, and brought them up the valley of Achor.

content: 25 And Joshua said— Why hast thou troubled us? Yahweh will trouble thee this day. And all Israel stoned him with stones, and burned them up with fire, and covered them with stones;
content_old: 25 And Joshua said— Why hast thou troubled us? Yahweh will trouble thee this day. And all Israel stoned him with stones, and burned them up with fire, and covered them with stones;

content: 1 Then said Yahweh unto Joshua— Do not fear nor be dismayed, take w h thee all the army, and arise､ go up to Ai,—see! I have given into thy hand､ the king of Ai and his people, and his city､ and his land;
content_old: 1 Then said Yahweh unto Joshua— Do not fear nor be dismayed, take w h thee all the army, and arise､ go up to Ai,—see! I have given into thy hand､ the king of Ai and his people, and his city､ and his land;

content: 2 so shalt thou do unto Ai and to her king､ as thou didst unto Jericho and unto her king, save only the spoil thereof and the cattle thereof shall ye take as your own prey,—set thee an ambush for the city､ behind it.
content_old: 2 so shalt thou do unto Ai and to her king､ as thou didst unto Jericho and unto her king, save only the spoil thereof and the cattle thereof shall ye take as your own prey,—set thee an ambush for the city､ behind it.

content: 3 So Joshua arose､ and all the people of war､ to go up to Ai,—and Joshua chose out thirty thousand men､ the mighty men of valour､ and sent them forth by night.
content_old: 3 So Joshua arose､ and all the people of war､ to go up to Ai,—and Joshua chose out thirty thousand men､ the mighty men of valour､ and sent them forth by night.

content: 4 And he commanded them､ saying— See! ye shall be lying in ambush against the city､ behind the city, do not go very far from the city,—so shall ye all be ready.
content_old: 4 And he commanded them､ saying— See! ye shall be lying in ambush against the city､ behind the city, do not go very far from the city,—so shall ye all be ready.

content: 5 But I､ and all the people who are with me will draw near unto the city,—and it shall be when they come out to meet us､ as at the first then will we flee before them;
content_old: 5 But I､ and all the people who are with me will draw near unto the city,—and it shall be when they come out to meet us､ as at the first then will we flee before them;

content: 6 so will they come out after us､ until we have drawn them away from the city, for they will say, Fleeing before us, as at the first! therefore will we flee before them.
content_old: 6 so will they come out after us､ until we have drawn them away from the city, for they will say, Fleeing before us, as at the first! therefore will we flee before them.

content: 7 Then ye shall rise up out of the ambush, and take possession of the city,—and Yahweh your God will deliver it into your hand.
content_old: 7 Then ye shall rise up out of the ambush, and take possession of the city,—and Yahweh your God will deliver it into your hand.

content: 8 And it shall be when ye have seized the city then shall ye burn the city with fire, according to the word of Yahweh shall ye do,—see! I have commanded you.
content_old: 8 And it shall be when ye have seized the city then shall ye burn the city with fire, according to the word of Yahweh shall ye do,—see! I have commanded you.

content: 9 So Joshua sent them forth､ and they went into ambush, and abode between Bethel and Ai､ on the west of Ai,—but Joshua lodged that night in the midst of the people.
content_old: 9 So Joshua sent them forth､ and they went into ambush, and abode between Bethel and Ai､ on the west of Ai,—but Joshua lodged that night in the midst of the people.

content: 10 And Joshua rose up early in the morning, and mustered the people,—and went up—he and the elders of Israel before the people, to Ai.
content_old: 10 And Joshua rose up early in the morning, and mustered the people,—and went up—he and the elders of Israel before the people, to Ai.

content: 11 And all the people of war who were with him went up､ and drew near, and came in､ right before the city,—and pitched on the north of Ai, with a valley between them and Ai.
content_old: 11 And all the people of war who were with him went up､ and drew near, and came in､ right before the city,—and pitched on the north of Ai, with a valley between them and Ai.

content: 12 And he took about five thousand men,—and set them in ambush between Bethel and Ai､ on the west of the city.
content_old: 12 And he took about five thousand men,—and set them in ambush between Bethel and Ai､ on the west of the city.

content: 13 And when the people had set all the host that was on the north of the city, with the rear thereof on the west of the city then went Joshua､ during the night､ into the midst of the valley.
content_old: 13 And when the people had set all the host that was on the north of the city, with the rear thereof on the west of the city then went Joshua､ during the night､ into the midst of the valley.

content: 14 And it came to pass when the king of Ai saw it that they hasted､ and rose up early､ and the men of the city came out to meet Israel for battle, he and all his people at an appointed time､ before the waste plain.—he not knowing that there was an ambush lying in wait for him､ behind the city.
content_old: 14 And it came to pass when the king of Ai saw it that they hasted､ and rose up early､ and the men of the city came out to meet Israel for battle, he and all his people at an appointed time､ before the waste plain.—he not knowing that there was an ambush lying in wait for him､ behind the city.

content: 15 So then Joshua and all Israel suffered themselves to be smitten before them,—and fled､ by the way of the wilderness:
content_old: 15 So then Joshua and all Israel suffered themselves to be smitten before them,—and fled､ by the way of the wilderness:

content: 16 and all the people who were in the city were called out to pursue them,—and they pursued Joshua, and so were drawn out away from the city.
content_old: 16 and all the people who were in the city were called out to pursue them,—and they pursued Joshua, and so were drawn out away from the city.

content: 17 And there remained not a man､ in Ai or Bethel, who had not gone out after Israel,—and they left the city open, and pursued Israel.
content_old: 17 And there remained not a man､ in Ai or Bethel, who had not gone out after Israel,—and they left the city open, and pursued Israel.

content: 18 Then said Yahweh unto Joshua— Stretch out with the javelin which is in thy hand､ towards Ai, for into thy hand will I deliver it. So Joshua stretched out with the javelin which was in his hand､ towards the city.
content_old: 18 Then said Yahweh unto Joshua— Stretch out with the javelin which is in thy hand､ towards Ai, for into thy hand will I deliver it. So Joshua stretched out with the javelin which was in his hand､ towards the city.

content: 19 And the ambush rose up quickly､ out of their place､ and ran､ when he stretched out his hand､ and entered the city､ and captured it,—and hasted, and set the city on fire.
content_old: 19 And the ambush rose up quickly､ out of their place､ and ran､ when he stretched out his hand､ and entered the city､ and captured it,—and hasted, and set the city on fire.

content: 20 And the men of Ai turned behind them､ and looked､ and lo! the smoke of the city had risen up towards the heavens, and there was in them no strength､ to flee this way or that way,—moreover the people that were fleeing to the wilderness turned back upon the pursuers.
content_old: 20 And the men of Ai turned behind them､ and looked､ and lo! the smoke of the city had risen up towards the heavens, and there was in them no strength､ to flee this way or that way,—moreover the people that were fleeing to the wilderness turned back upon the pursuers.

content: 21 Yea when Joshua and all Israel saw that the ambush had captured the city, and that the smoke of the city had risen up then returned they､ and smote the men of Ai.
content_old: 21 Yea when Joshua and all Israel saw that the ambush had captured the city, and that the smoke of the city had risen up then returned they､ and smote the men of Ai.

content: 22 And the others came forth out of the city to meet them, so they were in the midst of Israel､ some on this side､ and some on that side,—and they smote them, until there was left them none to remain or to escape.
content_old: 22 And the others came forth out of the city to meet them, so they were in the midst of Israel､ some on this side､ and some on that side,—and they smote them, until there was left them none to remain or to escape.

content: 23 And the king of Ai they caught alive,—and brought him near unto Joshua.
content_old: 23 And the king of Ai they caught alive,—and brought him near unto Joshua.

content: 24 And it came to pass when Israel had made an end of slaying all the inhabitants of Ai in the field､ in the wilderness whither they had pursued them, and all of them had fallen by the edge of the sword until they were consumed then all Israel returned to Ai, and smote it with the edge of the sword.
content_old: 24 And it came to pass when Israel had made an end of slaying all the inhabitants of Ai in the field､ in the wilderness whither they had pursued them, and all of them had fallen by the edge of the sword until they were consumed then all Israel returned to Ai, and smote it with the edge of the sword.

content: 25 And so it was､ that all who fell that day､ both of men and of women､ were twelve thousand,—all people of Ai.
content_old: 25 And so it was､ that all who fell that day､ both of men and of women､ were twelve thousand,—all people of Ai.

content: 26 Now Joshua drew not back his hand which he had stretched out with the javelin,—until he had utterly destroyed all the inhabitants of Ai.
content_old: 26 Now Joshua drew not back his hand which he had stretched out with the javelin,—until he had utterly destroyed all the inhabitants of Ai.

content: 27 Nevertheless the cattle and the spoil of that city Israel took as their own prey,—according to the word of Yahweh, which he commanded Joshua.
content_old: 27 Nevertheless the cattle and the spoil of that city Israel took as their own prey,—according to the word of Yahweh, which he commanded Joshua.

content: 28 So then Joshua burned Ai,—and made of it an age-abiding heap—a desolation, as it remaineth until this day.
content_old: 28 So then Joshua burned Ai,—and made of it an age-abiding heap—a desolation, as it remaineth until this day.

content: 29 And the king of Ai hanged he on a tree until eventide,—but at the going in of the sun Joshua gave command and they took down his dead body from the tree､ and cast it in at the opening of the gate of the city, and raised up over it a great heap of stones—which remaineth until this day.
content_old: 29 And the king of Ai hanged he on a tree until eventide,—but at the going in of the sun Joshua gave command and they took down his dead body from the tree､ and cast it in at the opening of the gate of the city, and raised up over it a great heap of stones—which remaineth until this day.

content: 30 Then built Joshua､ an altar, unto Yahweh､ God of Israel,—in Mount Ebal:
content_old: 30 Then built Joshua､ an altar, unto Yahweh､ God of Israel,—in Mount Ebal:

content: 31 as Moses､ the servant of Yahweh､ commanded the sons of Israel､ as it is written in the scroll of the law of Moses, an altar of whole stones, whereon had not been wielded any tool of iron,—and they caused to go up thereon､ ascending-sacrifices unto Yahweh, and sacrificed peace-offerings.
content_old: 31 as Moses､ the servant of Yahweh､ commanded the sons of Israel､ as it is written in the scroll of the law of Moses, an altar of whole stones, whereon had not been wielded any tool of iron,—and they caused to go up thereon､ ascending-sacrifices unto Yahweh, and sacrificed peace-offerings.

content: 32 Then wrote he there､ upon the stones､ a copy of the law of Moses､ which he wrote､ in the presence of the sons of Israel.
content_old: 32 Then wrote he there､ upon the stones､ a copy of the law of Moses､ which he wrote､ in the presence of the sons of Israel.

content: 33 And all Israel､ and their elders and officers､ and their judges were standing on this side and on that side of the ark､ before the priests the Levites､ who were bearing the ark of the covenant of Yahweh, as well the sojourner as the home-born, half of them over against Mount Gerizim, and half of them over against Mount Ebal,—as Moses the servant of Yahweh commanded to bless the sons of Israel､ first of all.
content_old: 33 And all Israel､ and their elders and officers､ and their judges were standing on this side and on that side of the ark､ before the priests the Levites､ who were bearing the ark of the covenant of Yahweh, as well the sojourner as the home-born, half of them over against Mount Gerizim, and half of them over against Mount Ebal,—as Moses the servant of Yahweh commanded to bless the sons of Israel､ first of all.

content: 34 And after that read he all the words of the law, the blessing and the cursing,—according to all that was written in the scroll of the law.
content_old: 34 And after that read he all the words of the law, the blessing and the cursing,—according to all that was written in the scroll of the law.

content: 1 And it came to pass､ when they heard,—namely, all the kings who were over the Jordan､ in the hill country and in the lowland､ and in all the coast of the great sea, over against the Lebanon,—the Hittite､ and the Amorite, the Canaanite､ the Perizzite, the Hivite､ and the Jebusite;—
content_old: 1 And it came to pass､ when they heard,—namely, all the kings who were over the Jordan､ in the hill country and in the lowland､ and in all the coast of the great sea, over against the Lebanon,—the Hittite､ and the Amorite, the Canaanite､ the Perizzite, the Hivite､ and the Jebusite;—

content: 2 then gathered they themselves together as one man, to fight with Joshua､ and with Israel,—with one accord.
content_old: 2 then gathered they themselves together as one man, to fight with Joshua､ and with Israel,—with one accord.

content: 3 Now the inhabitants of Gibeon heard that which Joshua had done unto Jericho and unto Ai;
content_old: 3 Now the inhabitants of Gibeon heard that which Joshua had done unto Jericho and unto Ai;

content: 4 they however､ acted craftily, and went and started,—and took old sacks for their asses, and leathern wine bottles, old､ and rent､ and bound up;
content_old: 4 they however､ acted craftily, and went and started,—and took old sacks for their asses, and leathern wine bottles, old､ and rent､ and bound up;

content: 5 and sandals､ old and patched､ upon their feet, and worn-out mantles upon them,—and all the bread of their provision was dry and broken.
content_old: 5 and sandals､ old and patched､ upon their feet, and worn-out mantles upon them,—and all the bread of their provision was dry and broken.

content: 6 So they took their journey unto Joshua､ unto the camp､ at Gilgal,—and said unto him､ and unto the men of Israel､ From a far country are we come, Now therefore､ solemnise with us a covenant.
content_old: 6 So they took their journey unto Joshua､ unto the camp､ at Gilgal,—and said unto him､ and unto the men of Israel､ From a far country are we come, Now therefore､ solemnise with us a covenant.

content: 7 And the men of Israel said unto the Hivites,— Peradventure in our midst ye are dwelling, how then can we solemnise with you a covenant?
content_old: 7 And the men of Israel said unto the Hivites,— Peradventure in our midst ye are dwelling, how then can we solemnise with you a covenant?

content: 8 And they said unto Joshua: Thy servants we are. And Joshua said unto them: Who are ye? And from whence come ye?
content_old: 8 And they said unto Joshua: Thy servants we are. And Joshua said unto them: Who are ye? And from whence come ye?

content: 9 And they said unto him— From a very far country have thy servants come, because of the name of Yahweh thy God,—because we had heard his fame, and all that he had done in Egypt;
content_old: 9 And they said unto him— From a very far country have thy servants come, because of the name of Yahweh thy God,—because we had heard his fame, and all that he had done in Egypt;

content: 10 and all that he had done unto the two kings of the Amorites who were over the Jordan,—unto Sihon､ king of Heshbon, and unto Og､ king of Bashan､ who was in Ashtaroth.
content_old: 10 and all that he had done unto the two kings of the Amorites who were over the Jordan,—unto Sihon､ king of Heshbon, and unto Og､ king of Bashan､ who was in Ashtaroth.

content: 11 So our elders and all the inhabitants of our land spake unto us､ saying— Take ye､ in your hand､ provision for the journey, and go your way to meet them,—then shall ye say unto them､ Your servants we are. Now therefore､ solemnise with us a covenant.
content_old: 11 So our elders and all the inhabitants of our land spake unto us､ saying— Take ye､ in your hand､ provision for the journey, and go your way to meet them,—then shall ye say unto them､ Your servants we are. Now therefore､ solemnise with us a covenant.

content: 12 This our bread took we hot for our provision��� out of our houses, on the day we came forth to journey unto you,—but now lo! it is dry､ yea it is broken;
content_old: 12 This our bread took we hot for our provision��� out of our houses, on the day we came forth to journey unto you,—but now lo! it is dry､ yea it is broken;

content: 13 and these leathern wine bottles､ which we filled new lo! also､ they are rent,—and as for these our mantles and our sandals they are worn out､ by reason of the very long journey.
content_old: 13 and these leathern wine bottles､ which we filled new lo! also､ they are rent,—and as for these our mantles and our sandals they are worn out､ by reason of the very long journey.

content: 14 So the men took of their provision,—but the bidding of Yahweh had they not asked.
content_old: 14 So the men took of their provision,—but the bidding of Yahweh had they not asked.

content: 15 And Joshua made peace with them､ and solemnised with them a covenant to let them live,—and the princes of the assembly､ entered into an oath with them.
content_old: 15 And Joshua made peace with them､ and solemnised with them a covenant to let them live,—and the princes of the assembly､ entered into an oath with them.

content: 16 And it came to pass at the end of three days after they had solemnised with them a covenant that they heard that near neighbours they were unto them, and in their midst they were dwelling.
content_old: 16 And it came to pass at the end of three days after they had solemnised with them a covenant that they heard that near neighbours they were unto them, and in their midst they were dwelling.

content: 17 So the sons of Israel brake up､ and came in unto their cities on the third day,—their cities being Gibeon､ and Chephirah, and Beeroth､ and Kiriath-jearim.
content_old: 17 So the sons of Israel brake up､ and came in unto their cities on the third day,—their cities being Gibeon､ and Chephirah, and Beeroth､ and Kiriath-jearim.

content: 18 And the sons of Israel smote them not, because the princes of the assembly had sworn unto them by Yahweh､ God of Israel,—but all the assembly murmured against the princes.
content_old: 18 And the sons of Israel smote them not, because the princes of the assembly had sworn unto them by Yahweh､ God of Israel,—but all the assembly murmured against the princes.

content: 19 And all the princes said unto all the assembly, We have sworn unto them, by Yahweh､ God of Israel,—now therefore､ we may not touch them.
content_old: 19 And all the princes said unto all the assembly, We have sworn unto them, by Yahweh､ God of Israel,—now therefore､ we may not touch them.

content: 20 This will we do unto them､ even let them live,—lest there come on us wrath, because of the oath which we have sworn unto them.
content_old: 20 This will we do unto them､ even let them live,—lest there come on us wrath, because of the oath which we have sworn unto them.

content: 21 And the princes said unto them— Let them live. So they became hewers of wood and drawers of water unto all the assembly, as the princes spake unto them.
content_old: 21 And the princes said unto them— Let them live. So they became hewers of wood and drawers of water unto all the assembly, as the princes spake unto them.

content: 22 And Joshua called for them, and spake unto them､ saying,— Wherefore did ye deceive us､ saying— We are very far from you, whereas ye in our midst are dwelling?
content_old: 22 And Joshua called for them, and spake unto them､ saying,— Wherefore did ye deceive us､ saying— We are very far from you, whereas ye in our midst are dwelling?

content: 23 Now therefore､ accursed ye are,—and ye shall not cease to be in bond-service as hewers of wood and drawers of water､ for the house of my God.
content_old: 23 Now therefore､ accursed ye are,—and ye shall not cease to be in bond-service as hewers of wood and drawers of water､ for the house of my God.

content: 24 And they responded to Joshua､ and said— Because it was plainly told thy servants､ how that Yahweh thy God had commanded Moses his servant to give unto you all the land, and to destroy all the inhabitants of the land from before you,—therefore feared we greatly､ for our lives､ because of you, and did this thing.
content_old: 24 And they responded to Joshua､ and said— Because it was plainly told thy servants､ how that Yahweh thy God had commanded Moses his servant to give unto you all the land, and to destroy all the inhabitants of the land from before you,—therefore feared we greatly､ for our lives､ because of you, and did this thing.

content: 25 Now therefore､ here we are in thy hand,—as may be good and right in thine eyes､ to do unto us do.
content_old: 25 Now therefore､ here we are in thy hand,—as may be good and right in thine eyes､ to do unto us do.

content: 26 And he did to them so,—and rescued them out of the hand of the sons of Israel､ and they slew them not.
content_old: 26 And he did to them so,—and rescued them out of the hand of the sons of Israel､ and they slew them not.

content: 1 And it came to pass when Adonizedec､ king of Jerusalem､ heard that Joshua had captured Ai､ and devoted it to destruction, as he had done unto Jericho and her king so had he done unto Ai and her king,—and that the inhabitants of Gibeon had made peace with Israel and had come into their midst
content_old: 1 And it came to pass when Adonizedec､ king of Jerusalem､ heard that Joshua had captured Ai､ and devoted it to destruction, as he had done unto Jericho and her king so had he done unto Ai and her king,—and that the inhabitants of Gibeon had made peace with Israel and had come into their midst

content: 2 then feared they greatly, because Gibeon was a great city, as one of the royal cities,—and because it was greater than Ai､ and all the men thereof were mighty:
content_old: 2 then feared they greatly, because Gibeon was a great city, as one of the royal cities,—and because it was greater than Ai､ and all the men thereof were mighty:

content: 3 therefore sent Adonizedec､ king of Jerusalem､ unto Hoham､ king of Hebron､ and unto Piram､ king of Jarmuth､ and unto Japhia､ king of Lachish､ and unto Debir､ king of Eglon､ saying:
content_old: 3 therefore sent Adonizedec､ king of Jerusalem､ unto Hoham､ king of Hebron､ and unto Piram､ king of Jarmuth､ and unto Japhia､ king of Lachish､ and unto Debir､ king of Eglon､ saying:

content: 4 Come up unto me and help me, that we may smite Gibeon,—for it hath made peace with Joshua､ and with the sons of Israel.
content_old: 4 Come up unto me and help me, that we may smite Gibeon,—for it hath made peace with Joshua､ and with the sons of Israel.

content: 5 So they gathered themselves together and came up､ even the five kings of the Amorites—the king of Jerusalem､ the king of Hebron､ the king of Jarmuth､ the king of Lachish､ the king of Eglon,—they､ and all their hosts,—and encamped near Gibeon, and made war against it.
content_old: 5 So they gathered themselves together and came up､ even the five kings of the Amorites—the king of Jerusalem､ the king of Hebron､ the king of Jarmuth､ the king of Lachish､ the king of Eglon,—they､ and all their hosts,—and encamped near Gibeon, and made war against it.

content: 6 So the men of Gibeon sent unto Joshua､ unto the camp at Gilgal､ saying, Do not withhold thy hand from thy servants,— Come up unto us quickly､ and save us､ and help us, for all the kings of the Amorites that dwell in the hill-country､ are gathered together against us.
content_old: 6 So the men of Gibeon sent unto Joshua､ unto the camp at Gilgal､ saying, Do not withhold thy hand from thy servants,— Come up unto us quickly､ and save us､ and help us, for all the kings of the Amorites that dwell in the hill-country､ are gathered together against us.

content: 7 So Joshua went up from Gilgal､ he and all the people of war with him, even all the mighty men of valour.
content_old: 7 So Joshua went up from Gilgal､ he and all the people of war with him, even all the mighty men of valour.

content: 8 And Yahweh said unto Joshua: Do not fear because of them, for into thy hand have I delivered them,—not a man of them shall stand before thee.
content_old: 8 And Yahweh said unto Joshua: Do not fear because of them, for into thy hand have I delivered them,—not a man of them shall stand before thee.

content: 9 So then Joshua came in unto them､ suddenly,—all the night came he up､ from Gilgal.
content_old: 9 So then Joshua came in unto them､ suddenly,—all the night came he up､ from Gilgal.
